page.title: I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK series 9)

revisions.rev:

Get Me out of Here!]] | image = | series = Series Nine (2009) | previous = I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK series 8)|Series 8 | next = I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK series 10)|Series 10 | hm1 = Gino D'Acampo | hm1-exit = Day 21 | hm1-enter = Day 1 | hm1-stat = winner | hm2 = Kim Woodburn | hm2-exit = Day 21 | hm2-enter = Day 1 | hm2-stat = runner | hm3 = Jimmy White | hm3-exit = Day 21 | hm3-enter = Day 1 | hm3-stat = evic | hm4 = Justin Ryan | hm4-exit = Day 20 | hm4-enter = Day 1 | hm4-stat = evic | hm5 = Stuart Manning | hm5-exit = Day 19 | hm5-enter = Day 1 | hm5-stat = evic | hm6 = Sabrina Washington | hm6-exit = Day 18 | hm6-enter = Day 1 | hm6-stat = evic | hm7 = George Hamilton | hm7-exit = Day 17 | hm7-enter = Day 1 | hm7-stat = five | hm8 = Joe Bugner | hm8-exit = Day 16 | hm8-enter = Day 4 | hm8-stat = evic | hm9 = Samantha Fox | hm9-exit = Day 14 | hm9-enter = Day 1 | hm9-stat = evic | hm10 = Colin McAllister | hm10-exit = Day 11 | hm10-enter = Day 1 | hm10-stat = evic | hm11 = Lucy Benjamin | hm11-exit = Day 10 | hm11-enter = Day 1 | hm11-stat = evic | hm12 = Katie Price | hm12-exit = Day 9 | hm12-enter = Day 2 | hm12-stat = five | hm13 = Camilla Dallerup | hm13-exit = Day 4 | hm13-enter = Day 1 | hm13-stat = five | legend5 = Withdrew }} '''''[[I'm a Celebrity... Get Me out of Here! (UK)|I'm a Celebrity... Get Me out of Here!]]''''' returned to [[ITV1]] and [[ITV2]] for a ninth series from 15 November 2009. It broadcasted for three weeks and concluded on 4 December 2009. There was however an additional episode on 7 December 2009, showing all the celebrities and what they did after they left the jungle. [[Gino D'Acampo]] and [[Stuart Manning]] were initially charged by [[New South Wales Police]] after [[RSPCA Australia]] complained over their killing and eating of a rat during the show, the killing of animals for performance being illegal.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/8397691.stm |title=I'm A Celebrity's D'Acampo and Manning face rat charges |publisher=BBC |date=6 December 2009|accessdate=7 December 2009 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5lqcbUN27 |archivedate=7 December 2009}} ITV apologised for not having properly advised the contestants of Australian legislation regarding animal cruelty.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/8398734.stm |title=ITV apologises for rat killing on I'm A Celebrity... |publisher=BBC News |date=7 December 2009 |accessdate=7 December 2009 |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5lqcGwo7L |archivedate=7 December 2009 }} However, the charges were dropped against D'Acampo and Manning when ITV accepted responsibility for the incident. They were subsequently charged around Â£1600.{{cite news| url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/tvandradio/7186106/ITV-fined-1600-for-animal-cruelty-over-Im-a-Celebrity-rat-stunt.html |work=The Daily Telegraph |location=London | title=ITV fined Â£1,600 for animal cruelty over I'm a Celebrity rat stunt | first=Aislinn | last=Laing | date=8 February 2010 | accessdate=4 May 2010}} ==Presenters== [[Ant & Dec]] returned to present the main show.{{cite web|last=Lea |first=Andy |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/view/82884/I-m-A-Celebrity-family-reunion/ |title=Simply The Best 7 Days A Week :: News :: I'm A Celebrity family reunion |publisher=Daily Star |date=31 May 2009 |accessdate=9 December 2009}} [[Emma Willis]] and [[Matt Willis]] stood down from the role as presenters of ''[[I'm a Celebrity... Get Me out of Here! Now]]'' and were replaced by last year's winner [[Joe Swash]] and [[Caroline Flack]] for the 2009 series.{{cite news | url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/celebs-on-sunday/2009/11/08/joe-swash-i-d-go-back-in-the-jungle-tomorrow-115875-21798124/ | title=Joe Swash: âIâd go back in the jungle tomorrowâ | first=Rhiannon | last=Vivian | date=8 November 2009 | accessdate=16 December 2010 | newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]] }} ==Celebrities== The participants were:{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1226845/Im-A-Celebrity-Katie-Price-stops-LA-Botox-ahead-return-jungle.html|title=I'm A Celebrity full line-up revealed: Katie Price's rivals to include 'Gorgeous' George Hamilton and no-nonsense How Clean Is Your House? host Kim Woodburn|date=11 November 2009|work=Daily Mail |location=UK|accessdate=11 November 2009}} {| class=wikitable |- ! Celebrity ! Famous for ! Status |- |[[Camilla Dallerup]] |''[[Strictly Come Dancing]]'' professional dancer | style="background:plum; text-align:center;"| Withdrew |- |[[Katie Price]] |Former glamour model | style="background:plum; text-align:center;"| Withdrew |- |[[Lucy Benjamin]] |Former ''[[EastEnders]]'' actress | style="background:tomato; text-align:center;"| Eliminated 1st |- |[[Colin McAllister]] |Interior designer and TV presenter | style="background:tomato; text-align:center;"|Eliminated 2nd |- |[[Samantha Fox]] | Former model and singer | style="background:tomato; text-align:center;"| Eliminated 3rd |- |[[Joe Bugner]] |Former heavyweight boxer | style="background:tomato; text-align:center;"| Eliminated 4th |- |[[George Hamilton (actor)|George Hamilton]] |American actor | style="background:plum; text-align:center;"| Withdrew{{cite web|url=http://www.new-magazine.co.uk//latestnews/view/15771/I-m-A-Celebrity-George-Hamilton-quits/ |title=If it's hot, it's here :: Latest News :: I'm A Celebrity: George Hamilton quits |publisher=new! Magazine |accessdate=9 December 2009}} |- |[[Sabrina Washington]] |Singer, former member of [[Mis-Teeq]] | style="background:tomato; text-align:center;"| Eliminated 5th |- |[[Stuart Manning]] |Former ''[[Hollyoaks]]'' actor | style="background:tomato; text-align:center;"| Eliminated 6th |- |[[Justin Ryan]] |Interior designer and TV presenter | style="background:tomato; text-align:center;"| Eliminated 7th |- |[[Jimmy White]] |[[Snooker]] player | style="background:tomato; text-align:center;"| Eliminated 8th |- |[[Kim Woodburn]] |''[[How Clean is Your House?]]'' presenter | style="background:yellow; text-align:center;"|Runner Up |- |[[Gino D'Acampo]] |Celebrity Chef | style="background:#73fb76; text-align:center;"|Winner |} ==Camps== The contestants made their way into the jungle in a variety of ways, including sky-diving and hiking. They were situated in the base camp used in previous series. On Day 5 the camp was split into 2 teams. Each celebrity had to draw a stick and the 2 with a coloured tip were captains and took turns to select their team members. Colin picked Justin, Katie, Sabrina, Jimmy and Joe. Lucy picked Gino, Stuart, George, Sam and Kim. A trial followed in which they were each positioned under a bucket and using a stick had to balance the contents of the bucket by keeping a button pressed. The winning team was the one that had the final member still standing after all of their opponents had been eliminated. Sabrina was the final contestant to survive, making Colinâs team the winner. They were excluded from the first elimination vote and lived in the relative luxury of base camp. Base Camp was transformed into a relative jungle paradise. It was furnished with camp chairs, pillows for the beds, dressing gowns, firewood and purified water. Lucyâs team entered the Exile camp. It was a rat infested clearing containing only the bare essentials, with one log to sit on and only one bed, no shower and only rice and beans to eat. Over the next 3 days, everyone in Exile Camp participated in a Bush Battle with the winner of each one being allowed to return to Base Camp and gain immunity from the first public elimination vote. The battles were won by Stuart, Kim and George. While the camp was split, all celebrities selected for Bushtucker Trials competed for 12 stars as usual. However, the first meals were allocated to Base Camp, 1 for each member at the time with any remainder providing food to the Exile team, except for Vile Vending in which Kim competed for 5 stars for Exile while Katie competed for 7 for base camp. This would have placed added pressure on any Exile member who completed a 1-person trial, as they would have had to collect all 12 stars to feed their own camp, however Katie competed in both of them, and, despite trying, failed to get all stars in any of her 6 trials. On Day 8 the two camps reunited, located at 'Base Camp'. ==Results and Elimination== :{{colorbox|#EEE8AA}} Indicates that the celebrity was immune from the vote :{{colorbox|lightgreen}} Indicates that the celebrity received the most votes :{{colorbox|#FFC0CB}} Indicates that the celebrity received the fewest votes and was eliminated immediately (no bottom two/three) :{{colorbox|#87D3F8}} Indicates that the celebrity was in the bottom two or three in the public vote {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:85%" |- !style="width:5%" colspan=2 | !style="width:4%" | Day 10 !style="width:4%" | Day 11 !style="width:4%" | Day 13 !style="width:4%" | Day 14 !style="width:4%" | Day 16 !style="width:4%" | Day 17 !style="width:4%" | Day 18 !style="width:4%" | Day 19 !style="width:4%" | Day 20 !style="width:8%" colspan=2 | Day 21

to win |} Voting stats here:http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s100/im-a-celebrity-uk/news/a190506/im-a-celebrity-voting-stats-revealed.html {{note|1|1}} On Day 13, all of the celebrities faced the public vote, with the bottom three being revealed as Samantha, Sabrina and Jimmy. The other celebrities were declared safe, and the phone lines for the bottom three reopened for another 24 hours.
{{note|2|2}} On Day 15, all of the celebrities faced the public vote, with the bottom two being revealed as Joe and Stuart. The other celebrities were declared safe and both Joe and Stuart would go to Jungle Jail where they will go head to head with the winner returning to camp and the loser being eliminated from camp. Joe lost the trial to Stuart, therefore he was eliminated.
{{note|3|3}} On Day 14 the bottom two (who were Jimmy White & Samantha Fox) were not revealed on air. ==Bushtucker Trials== The contestants take part in daily trials to earn food :{{colorbox|#99CCFF}} The public voted for who they wanted to face the trial :{{colorbox|#6699CC}} The contestants decided who did which trial :{{colorbox|lightgreen}} The trial was compulsory and neither the public or celebrities decided who took part {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" |- ! {{note|1|1}} This trial determined how many beds and dinners would be in camp.
{{note|2|2}} Kim and George were excluded from this trial on medical grounds.
{{note|3|3}} George was excluded from this trial on medical grounds.
{{note|4|4}} This was a live trial.
{{note|5|5}} In a twist the celebrity from each camp who received the most votes faced the trial together.
{{note|6|6}} As Katie left the jungle on Day 9, Kim joined Joe in this trial as she received the third highest amount of votes.
{{note|7|7}} Kim, George and Joe were excluded from this trial.
{{note|8|8}} This trial decided who left the jungle (which was Joe) and not how camp were fed that night. It was not revealed if the camp had to earn their meals.
{{note|9|9}} Kim was excluded from this trial on medical grounds, so her star was taken by Gino.
{{note|10|10}}Kim and Joe competed in four rounds of both having the same drinks, to win all 8 meals, then completed another with different drinks to win the ninth meal and a chocolate treat. During this final round Kim vomited her "sampuka" on Ant and Dec, and was told it didn't count, but was given another, which she drank.
